answers.answer: As a neonatologist, I am not the best type of physician to answer your questions.  You need to discuss your questions with the Perinatologist who has been following your pregnancy.  That physician would be best suited for knowledgeably discussing the situation with you since they would know all of your pregnancy and medical history.

question: I have a history of graves disease with a recent total thyroidectomy (Sept 2008), IUGR and Preeclampsia with last pregnancy (delivery Aug 2007) I am 23 years old and 36 weeks and 4 days I am followed in HROB due to past pregnancy issues. I had hypothyroidism until last month due to meds finally being adjusted correctly. I had elevated risk from quad screen of having an infant with Trisomy 21, 1st ultrasound reduced risk to 1:296. I have been monitored every 4 weeks thorugh ultrasound and last ultrasound in March 2009 showed mild polyhydraminos, AFI: 26.7. the size of the baby was measuring 31 weeks 5 days (2 days off) They did not find any GI blockage. Yesterday I had my, hopefully, last ultrasound and the fluid had decreased to 20 but now the baby is measuring 1 week and 6 days off (34 and 4 days). Is this normal to be off by this much, everytime I look up anything I find Trisomy 21 somehow related, but then everything could be idiopathic, I just want to be worry free. Please help! Thanks.
title: Is this normal?
